channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump to address affordability. And, the significance of Indiana's redistricting fight
item.description: Trump travels to Pennsylvania to discuss America's affordability. And, Indiana lawmakers to vote on a congressional map that may eliminate the state's last two Democratic seats.
item.content:encoded:
Trump travels to Pennsylvania to discuss America's affordability. And, Indiana lawmakers to vote on a congressional map that may eliminate the state's last two Democratic seats.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: President Trump expected to address affordability at Pennsylvania rally
item.description: President Trump will hold a rally in Pennsylvania Tuesday, where he's expected to talk about his administration's efforts to address two major concerns for voters: the economy and affordability.
item.content:encoded: President Trump will hold a rally in Pennsylvania Tuesday, where he's expected to talk about his administration's efforts to address two major concerns for voters: the economy and affordability.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Are we in a recession? Maybe professional Santas can tell us
item.description: Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?
item.content:encoded:
Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?

(Image credit: Bennett Raglin)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
item.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.
item.content:encoded:
Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

(Image credit: Carlos Morales)
item.dc:creator: Carlos Morales

item.title: The GOP has allowed Trump to expand his authority. Here's where they're pushing back
item.description: Republicans in Congress have shown some willingness to push back on President Trump, but it is not clear how far they are willing to push back against the leader of their own party.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans in Congress have shown some willingness to push back on President Trump, but it is not clear how far they are willing to push back against the leader of their own party.

(Image credit: Zayrha Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: A 101-year-old runs the largest nutcracker museum in the U.S. Here's a look inside
item.description: Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenworth Nutcracker Museum in Washington.
item.content:encoded:
Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenworth Nutcracker Museum in Washington.

(Image credit: Chona Kasinger for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: After NIH grant cuts, breast cancer research at Harvard slowed, and lab workers left
item.description: Amid NIH funding delays, reversals and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one-third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.
item.content:encoded:
Amid NIH funding delays, reversals and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one-third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.

(Image credit: Robin Lubbock)
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: Honduras seeks arrest of ex-President Hernández after Trump pardon
item.description: Honduras' attorney general said Monday that he had ordered Honduran authorities and asked Interpol to execute a 2023 arrest order for Juan Orlando Hernández, pardoned by U.S. President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Honduras' attorney general said Monday that he had ordered Honduran authorities and asked Interpol to execute a 2023 arrest order for Juan Orlando Hernández, pardoned by U.S. President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Moises Castillo)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: When Christmas is a little too bright ... look to Krampus
item.description: If Santa Claus is the good cop of Christmas, then Krampus is the bad one: a creature from European folklore who scares children into behaving themselves, complete with goat horns and gnashing teeth.
item.content:encoded:
If Santa Claus is the good cop of Christmas, then Krampus is the bad one: a creature from European folklore who scares children into behaving themselves, complete with goat horns and gnashing teeth.

(Image credit: Celeste Noche for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Syria marks a year since Assad fled, but struggles to heal
item.description: Syria is struggling to heal a year after the Assad dynasty's repressive 50-year reign came to an end following 14 years of civil war that left the country battered and divided.
item.content:encoded:
Syria is struggling to heal a year after the Assad dynasty's repressive 50-year reign came to an end following 14 years of civil war that left the country battered and divided.

(Image credit: Ghaith Alsayed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
